alert.note: Alert for Northern Hancock; Pearl River; Southern Hancock (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 26 at 2:36AM CDT by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of St. Tammany and southwestern Washington Parishes, Hancock and southwestern Pearl River Counties through 315 AM CDT... At 236 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Folsom to near Bush to near Kiln. Movement was south at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Slidell, Picayune, Bay St. Louis, Covington, Waveland, Diamondhead, Pearl River, Abita Springs, Madisonville, Folsom, Kiln, Pearlington, Lacombe, Shoreline Park, Stennis Space Center, Bush and Slidell Airport. This includes the following Interstates... Interstate 10 in Louisiana between mile markers 261 and 273. Interstate 10 in Mississippi between mile markers 1 and 16. Interstate 12 between mile markers 54 and 84. Interstate 59 in Louisiana between mile markers 1 and 11. Interstate 59 in Mississippi between mile markers 1 and 9. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 500 AM CDT for southern Mississippi.

area.areaDesc: Northern Hancock; Pearl River; Southern Hancock
